column4: i've installed XFCE using apt-get, but when i log out, there isn't any XFCE in the Sessions list... how do i use XFCE?
should i uninstall xfce?
and then install xfce4?
ok i'll do xfce4
oho k
As dabar sais. aptitude is "the bettery way"(tm)
sudo aptitude install xfce4, but yes.
what time is it?
uh, 9:20 pm?
Well, get your evenin' meal done and go to sleep. It might be done when you wake up. :p
it needs it and it will install it.
might not configure it for you though...
xorg?
yes.
if you've got gnome then you've got xorg.
thus it won't install it or touch your xorg.conf
i know, i was talking to geez
Then you might want to prefix with geez:  hehe
That's what happens when people use nicks that look like d00d sp34k for jees :p
geez, c'mon. :p
You might need to restart the X-server with CTRL+ALT+BackSpace before it appears in gdm
